sect3.title: Hexadecimal strings are no longer considered numeric
sect3.para: Strings containing hexadecimal numbers are no longer considered to be numeric. For example:
sect3.informalexample:
<?php
var_dump("0x123" == "291");
var_dump(is_numeric("0x123"));
var_dump("0xe" + "0x1");
var_dump(substr("foo", "0x1"));
?>

sect3.para: filter_var can be used to check if a string contains a hexadecimal number, and also to convert a string of that type to an int:

informalexample.programlisting:
<?php
$str = "0xffff";
$int = filter_var($str, FILTER_VALIDATE_INT, FILTER_FLAG_ALLOW_HEX);
if (false === $int) {
    throw new Exception("Invalid integer!");
}
var_dump($int); // int(65535)
?>

sect3.title: \u{ may cause errors
sect3.para: Due to the addition of the new Unicode codepoint escape syntax, strings containing a literal \u{ followed by an invalid sequence will cause a fatal error. To avoid this, the leading backslash should be escaped.
